# Enter your code here. Read input from STDIN. Print output to STDOUT
from __future__ import division
from collections import namedtuple

num_students = int(raw_input())
column_names = raw_input().split()

Student = namedtuple('Student', ' '.join(column_names))

total_marks = 0

for i in range(num_students):
    student_info = raw_input().split()
    student = Student(student_info[0], student_info[1], student_info[2], student_info[3])
    total_marks += int(student.MARKS)

print total_marks / num_students

from collections import namedtuple

n = int(input())
students = namedtuple('students', input())
print("{:.2f}".format(sum([int(students._make(input().split()).MARKS) for _ in range(n)]) / n))

# Enter your code here. Read input from STDIN. Print output to STDOUT
from collections import namedtuple

n = int(input())
columns = input().split()

total = 0
for i in range(n):
    student = namedtuple('student', columns)
    column1, column2, column3, column4 = input().split()
    student = student(column1, column2, column3, column4)
    total += int(student.MARKS)

print('{:.2f}'.format(total/n))

from collections import namedtuple

N = int(input())
columns = input().split()

Student = namedtuple('Student', columns)

marks = 0
for i in range(N):
    student = Student(*input().split())
    marks += int(student.MARKS)

print(marks / N)

# Enter your code here. Read input from STDIN. Print output to STDOUT
from collections import namedtuple

n = int(input())
Student = namedtuple('Student', input())

total = 0
for _ in range(n):
    total += int(Student(*input().split()).MARKS)

print(total / n)

from collections import namedtuple

N = int(input())
columns = input().split()

total = 0

for _ in range(N):
    student = namedtuple('student', columns)
    column1, column2, column3, column4 = input().split()
    student = student(column1, column2, column3, column4)
    total += int(student.MARKS)

print('{:.2f}'.format(total / N))

# Enter your code here. Read input from STDIN. Print output to STDOUT
from collections import namedtuple

n = int(input())
columns = input().split()

Student = namedtuple('Student', columns)
marks = [int(Student._make(input().split()).MARKS) for _ in range(n)]
print((sum(marks) / len(marks)))
